front.note: Confidential: not for distribution. Submitted to IOP Publishing for peer review

docTitle.titlePart:
Search for the 2 + Excitation of the Hoyle State in
12
C Using the 12 C( 12 C,3α) 12 C Reaction

byline.docAuthor:
T Muñoz-Britton 1 , M Freer 1 , N I Ashwood 1 , T A D Brown 2 ,
W N Catford 3 , N Curtis 1 , S P Fox 2 , B R Fulton 2 , C W Harlin 3 ,
A M Laird 2 , P Mumby-Croft 2 , A St. J Murphy 4 , P Papka 2 ,
D L Price 1 , K Vaughan 2 , D L Watson 2 and D C Weisser 5

byline.affiliation: 1 School of Physics and Astronomy, University of Birmingham,
2 Department of Physics, University of York,

3 Department of Physics, Faculty of Engineering & Physical Sciences, University of
Surrey,
3 School of Physics and Astronomy, The University of Edinburgh,

front.address:
James Clerk
Maxwell Building, Mayfield Road, Edinburgh, EH9 3JZ, United Kingdom

byline.affiliation: 5 The Research School of Physics and Engineering,

front.div:
Abstract. A search for the 2 + excitation of the Hoyle state in 12 C has been
performed using the 12 C( 12 C,3α) 12 C reaction at a beam energy of 101.5 MeV. An
angular correlation analysis was used to suppress known contributions to the excitation
energy spectrum, enhancing the experimental sensitivity. No strong evidence was found
for new states in 12 C between 9 and 11 MeV; rather upper limits for their excitation
in the 12 C+ 12 C inelastic scattering reaction are determined.
